title: AI & Software Systems Engineer
description:
- Working across software development, data engineering, and system design to support Gray Whale's product and platform initiatives
- Designing automation tools, internal services, and backend workflows to streamline operations and improve scalability
- Supporting creative and product-facing efforts, including interface design, marketing systems, and communication infrastructure

title: AI Engineer & Product Consultant
description:
- Developing intelligent assistant features that help surfers
- Leveraging large language models (LLMs) to power conversational tools and curated recommendations
- Supporting Onda's mission to make surf forecasting more personalized, contextual, and accessible
- Designing new product experiences at the intersection of AI, usability, and surf culture
- Advising Onda's marketing strategy, including recommending scalable outreach initiatives and influencing the hiring of a summer intern team to support marketing, content, and community efforts

title: Teaching Assistant
description:
- TA for courses led by Professor Paul Vroomen in the Technology Information Management Department
- Delivered academic support through office hours, grading assignments and exams, and lecturing to over 150 students; served as Lead TA, coordinating the TA/grading team
- Guided student learning across databases, SQL, business processes, information systems, systems analysis, UML modeling, and Agile/SCRUM methodologies
- Mentored student team projects focused on app development, supporting their use of industry practices from requirements gathering through sprint planning and stakeholder feedback

title: Software Developer & Consultant - Agile Methodology Specialist
description:
- Drove Boardal's app's growth to over 20,000 users through product improvements and automation tools
- Built GPT-powered systems to streamline marketing outreach and customer communication
- Created features like personalized alerts and spreadsheet-integrated tools to boost user engagement and team efficiency
- Led Agile adoption to speed up development and better align with user needs
- Contributed across the stack to expand app functionality and support startup growth

title: Surf Instructor
description:
- Taught private and group surf lessons to students of all ages and experience levels, adapting instruction to individual learning styles
- Emphasized ocean safety, hazard awareness, and proper navigation techniques in every session
- Introduced core surf skills and ocean knowledge, creating a strong foundation for beginner surfers
- Delivered a personalized and confidence-building learning environment in dynamic ocean conditions

title: Peer Advisor
description:
- Provided front-line support to a diverse student body, including four-year and transfer students, enhancing their academic experience.
- Assisted students with class enrollment, graduation planning, and petition processes, leveraging strong problem-solving skills.
- Directed students and visitors to appropriate departments and faculty, contributing positively to their academic journey.
- Utilized exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to connect individuals with necessary resources and support.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
- Ensured dorms and campus buildings were well-maintained, conducting repairs in rooms and maintaining plumbing systems.
- Responded promptly to maintenance requests from students and staff, ensuring a safe and comfortable living and learning environment.
- Kept detailed records of all maintenance work performed, demonstrating organizational skills and attention to detail.

title: Programs Assistant
description:
- Led the planning and execution of various Rachel Carson College community events, focusing on environmental and cultural themes, to enhance campus life.
- Developed and executed creative event concepts and educational content, promoting environmental awareness and enriching the college's thematic focus.
- Demonstrated strong organizational and project management skills, bringing innovative ideas to life and ensuring broad community engagement through comprehensive marketing campaigns.
- Utilized posters, social media, emails, and slideshows in collaboration with team members for event promotion and educational initiatives, effectively increasing awareness and participation.

company: Club Ed Surf School and Camps
title: Surf Instructor
description:
- Provided comprehensive surf lessons to individuals of diverse ages and skill levels, focusing on safety, technique, and personalized instruction.
- Delivered essential safety instructions to ensure students understood potential hazards and safe navigation of ocean conditions.
- Taught fundamental surf techniques, adjusting teaching methods to match the unique needs and abilities of each student for optimal learning.
- Maintained and managed surf equipment, ensuring all gear was in excellent condition for lessons.
- Assisted with the logistical aspects of equipment transportation, coordinating between the Club Ed Office and lesson locations.

title: Skateboarding Instructor
description:
- Designed and delivered individualized skateboarding lessons, adapting instruction to each student's skill level and learning pace
- Used hands-on, progressive techniques to build student confidence and foster an inclusive, encouraging environment for learners of all backgrounds and abilities
- Assisted in the Clash at Clairemont skateboarding demo event, supporting logistics and event setup for a showcase featuring pro skaters including Tony Hawk, Andy Macdonald, and many more
- Returned to teach a decade after attending the program myself, reflecting a full-circle experience and a deep connection to the skateboarding community
